title: Youtube????
body: can i get some feedback/comments on this video i made please?

replies.body:
Music's too loud, and gamesound is too loud.

Needs more voice sound for this kinda video :P

Source: I've done this style of video for a while.


Because of how quiet the voices are it's hard to interpret jokes properly, if you're using an editing program (which you are) you can usually edit the individual tracks of your own voice which is usually more important than other people since it's your video lol.

(not to plug my channel but if you want to search for my channel it can give you an idea of what I mean for correct audio levels. ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KZoSgr48-Rk )

If not I reccomend watching keyori and sp4zie and that for an idea of decent audio levels.

> [{quoted}](name=FA Mr4Eva,realm=OCE,application-id=hIjvqaz6,discussion-id=JGsAGcip,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-08-05T14:58:32.367+0000)

thanks

BADS

1. the music
The track used is the 8bit NES mix of 'Radioactive' by Rakohus. See, noone else would know, because it's not included in the description, or in the video. ( I just happen to know Rakohus ). I'd suggest crediting the music you use. As a further point, try not to use music that's been used by other people before, as it might feel unoriginal ( I think *u* know who ). Also, not something that matters now, but in the future, if you intend on making a dollar off youtube, you'll have to use songs that are either Copyright free, or songs you have permission to use, otherwise all of your monetization rights are forefeit.

2. the text
The exact same font everyone uses, because it's default on like, 5 different editing softwares. Try and spice things up a bit by using different, unique fonts. As an example, check out cooltext.com and get something that's fitting to your style. Try and make it unique, but still easy to read. You can also ( depending on your editing program ) do cool things like animate the text, so it doesn't feel stagnant. If you're subtitling action packed stuff, feel free to get them subtitles shaking a bit.

GOODS

1. the DP
The display picture is weird as hell, very click-baity for curious internet dwellers. It worked on me. Keep finding original stuff and keep it all interesting.

2. the Teemo
f*ck Teemo.

3. the content
Your gameplay might be average, but you've got a bit of personality, which you can definitely use.

I'm a veteran at this sort of thing, feel free to add me for any questions, comments, or help needed.

~J

thanks man, your comments are awesome!
also, yeah i should be crediting the music.
oops xD
